intro: Chorizema ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaf chorizema, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Chorizema ovalifolium is typically found in rocky or coastal habitats, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its native region.
